items.title: Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen Switch pre-orders now live, and these Pokémon titles are up to 30% off
items.summary:
The 2026 Pokémon Day festivities are already starting with this morning’s official announcements – the special 30-year anniversary Pokémon Presents showcase has been confirmed and Nintendo just announced Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen for Switch and Switch 2! All of the details you need on the Gen 1 remakes landing on Switch are right here – pre-orders are now live, but in celebration of today’s reveals we are highlighting a host of Pokémon Switch game deals you can scope out below:

  • Pokémon FireRed Version Switch pre-order $20
  • Pokémon LeafGreen Version Switch pre-order $20
  • Pokémon Legends: Z-A from $45 (Reg. $60)
  • Pokémon Sword $47 (Reg. $60)
  • Pokémon: Let’s Go, Eevee! $47 (Reg. $60)
  • Pokémon: Let’s Go, Pikachu! $42 (Reg. $60)
  • Pokémon Violet $47 (Reg. $60)
  • Pokémon Legends: Arceus $47 (Reg. $60)

Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen officially announced for Switch and Switch 2

Special 30-year anniversary Pokémon Presents announced

items.title: Wild 56% discount hits Anker’s tiny 3-in-1 Qi2 15W fold-out travel charger with 5-foot USB-C cable, 40W adapter at $40 all-time low
items.summary:
As part of its wider sale on charging gear, Woot is offering Anker’s 15W Qi2-certified 3-in-1 UFO MagGo charger for $39.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This is regularly a $90 unit, which is currently fetching $60.50 at Amazon. Woot had it for $45 last month as part of a short-lived Anker sale, but today’s 56% discount beats that price with an additional $5 off. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this charging unit, and it’s a solid price for a unit that can charge your iPhone, AirPods, and Apple Watch simultaneously. Head below for more details.

items.title: Today only: Save $390 on Samsung’s 40-inch Odyssey G7 180Hz WUHD curved gaming monitor
items.summary:
Today only, as part of its Deals of the Day offers, Best Buy has listed Samsung’s 40-inch Odyssey G7 (G75F) 180Hz gaming monitor for $709.99 shipped. That’s a straight-up $390 discount on its $1,100 usual going rate, and one of the lowest prices we have tracked for it to date. Today’s deal at Best Buy marks the lowest price we have tracked for this unit this year, and it’s now within just $60 of the all-time low price it hit last year during the holiday sale. The same monitor, in case you’re wondering, is currently going for $750 at both Amazon and directly at Samsung’s online store, so you’re looking at the best price for it at the moment at Best Buy. It’s one of the best options to consider if you’re in the market to buy an ultrawide display for your battlestation, and you can learn more about it below.

Tech companies are increasingly building private power plants to fuel off-grid data centers, a move some warn faces reliability challenges and climate risks  —  Tech companies are building data centers with their own private power plants, a risky bet that will increase carbon emissions and other pollution.

items.title: Perplexity's retreat from ads signals a strategic shift as it recognizes its product is not for a mass audience and expects growth to come from enterprise sales (Maxwell Zeff/Wired)

Maxwell Zeff / Wired:
Perplexity's retreat from ads signals a strategic shift as it recognizes its product is not for a mass audience and expects growth to come from enterprise sales  —  The AI search startup once predicted advertising would be a massive business.  Now it's betting on a smaller, more valuable audience.
